awd_titl_txt: WORKSHOP: A Transformational Africa-US STEM University Partnership: A Workshop
awd_abstract_narration:
The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine (NASEM) will hold a 3-day workshop on “A Transformational Africa-US STEM University Partnership". The workshop will bring together 30-40 senior public officials, and leaders from university, and the private sector from both Africa and the US. The Workshop will review experiences, achievements, and best practices of recent large-scale initiatives to build STEM research and education capacity in materials research and other related fields such as food security; energy; mining, minerals, and climate change on the continent and to promote collaboration with US counterparts. The workshop will also identify priorities for joint work and innovative modalities for collaboration between US and African universities. The proceedings will be published by the National Academies Press and disseminated. The workshop will include a diverse group of attendees, including underrepresented minorities and early career professionals. The Workshop is supported by the Division of Materials Research in the Mathematical and Physical Sciences Directorate, the Directorate for Geosciences, and the Office of International Sciences and Engineering.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The workshop initiated an important conversation amongst US academic institutions, government, and philanthropy on the need to engage with their counterparts on the African continent and the modalities of equitable partnerhips.

It disseminated lessons learned, promising practices, opportunities and gaps through the workshop recordings and the proceedings-in-brief. For example, the video recording of the sessions was viewed 2,923 times. The workshop proceedings in brief has been downloaded by almost 500 people in 70 countries and was disseminated through various channels (e.g. US-Africa Leaders Summit convened by the White house in December 2022).

Ideas and concepts from this workshop were instrumental in expanding outreach for the U.S-Africa Frontiers of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine program which held its first symposium in 2022. This program brings outstanding, early-career researchers from the U.S. and Africa together to explore collaborations and ideas to solve some of the most critical issues facing the U.S. and Africa. It also seeks to shift the paradigm of the U.S. being the experts to a dialogue where African and American researchers are treated as equals, with the same capacity and knowledge for solving these issues. Mainly thanks to the dissemination of the Frontiers program through the NSF funded workshop, NASEM received nearly 900 applications for the first US-Africa Frontiers symposium.
